chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: This document aims at guiding a system administrator throughout the parameterisation and administration of for a typical deployment environment.

The document initially provides an in-depth description of the application properties set-up, specially addressing the key parameters that must be correctly and carefully set-up to ensure the correct behaviour of , and additional parameters already set-up in the default configuration that could be of some use in order to implement a specific behaviour.

is delivered as a configured package that includes some default database data, fully described in a dedicated chapter: part of them are mandatory system data, others are default set-up proposed in order to ease the initial deployment and user administration tasks.

itself requires very low effort in terms of maintenance, mostly relying on the application server stability and overall capabilities (you may refer to the installation guide for the application server set-up). All application logs are generated in a unique specific output file, following coding rules. In order to ease the system's administration, the traces format is presented in this document, and the trapped errors listed in a dedicated annex, together with a corresponding proposed actions that the system administrator should undertake when encountering any issue.
